channel.title: Help needed with modeling problems
channel.description:
Hi, this is my first time adding models to a client, and im having some difficulty. Help would be lovely, and i would rep you or whatever you want.
so here's the story.
Trying to make a custom whip. i already colored them, both wield and drop models, and compiled them with 7z so they were rar files. I then put them into the clients models folder, added the correct ints into class 8, and compiled my client. So far so good. I went on the server with the client, and i typed add model 13000 (the wield model). It said couldn't find the model and dc'd me. I was told this was ok so i typed add model 13001 (the drop model), same thing happened. Then i tried to spawn the item using ::pickup 9000 1 (the item id of the whip as indicated in the int's). And it spawned into my inventory.... a banner. i could wield it to my right hand, but it was definitely not the model of the whip i had created. So i tried changing the name of the models to a lower number that was not taken, and in the int's as well as the model folder, the wield model was now 9100 and the drop model was now 9101. so i compiled, went on the server, added the models, spawned the item, and this time it added a wieldable shovel into my inventory. if anyone knows how to solve this please let me know, i will do anything to get the answer.
EDIT:i have narrowed down the problem to the fact that my client is unable to find the models, but i dont know why. It was able to find other models for a different custom item, but it cannot find my models. Can anyone help?
All the best, Zagyx

item.title: Help needed with modeling problems
item.dc:creator: @zagyx zagyx
item.description:
@zagyx wrote:

ok i have them added now! but i have another question, why does it make me invisible when i wield the weapon?

Read full topic

item.title: Help needed with modeling problems
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

First off your making recoloring a whip much too difficult. All you need are ints. You don’t need any models for a recolored whip.

Read full topic

item.title: Help needed with modeling problems
item.dc:creator: @zagyx zagyx
item.description:
@zagyx wrote:

Hi, this is my first time adding models to a client, and im having some difficulty. Help would be lovely, and i would rep you or whatever you want.

so here’s the story.

Trying to make a custom whip. i already colored them, both wield and drop models, and compiled them with 7z so they were rar files. I then put them into the clients models folder, added the correct ints into class 8, and compiled my client. So far so good. I went on the server with the client, and i typed add model 13000 (the wield model). It said couldn’t find the model and dc’d me. I was told this was ok so i typed add model 13001 (the drop model), same thing happened. Then i tried to spawn the item using ::pickup 9000 1 (the item id of the whip as indicated in the int’s). And it spawned into my inventory… a banner. i could wield it to my right hand, but it was definitely not the model of the whip i had created. So i tried changing the name of the models to a lower number that was not taken, and in the int’s as well as the model folder, the wield model was now 9100 and the drop model was now 9101. so i compiled, went on the server, added the models, spawned the item, and this time it added a wieldable shovel into my inventory. if anyone knows how to solve this please let me know, i will do anything to get the answer.

EDIT:i have narrowed down the problem to the fact that my client is unable to find the models, but i dont know why. It was able to find other models for a different custom item, but it cannot find my models. Can anyone help?

All the best,
Zagyx
